items.title: Forza Horizon 5 will require a Microsoft account on PS5
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- The PS5 version of Forza Horizon 5 requires linking a Microsoft account to PlayStation Network the first time you play.
- If you unlink the account later, you can only relink to the original Microsoft account.
- The game lacks cross-platform saving, meaning progress won’t transfer between PS5 and Xbox.
- Players will need a PlayStation Plus subscription for multiplayer access, with no plans for a disc release.
- The game is set to release on April 29th, continuing the trend of Xbox exclusives appearing on PS5.

items.title: From ChatGPT to Gemini: how AI is rewriting the internet
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- AI technologies are evolving, with Google and OpenAI competing to rewire the internet.
- Recent changes include the naming of Google’s AI as Gemini and the introduction of Gemini Apps powered by Gemini Flash 2.0.
- OpenAI releases GPT-4o, a faster, free model for ChatGPT users.
- Concerns about AI hallucinations and ethical issues like copyright lawsuits are highlighted.
- AI chatbots are compared with notable developments in Microsoft’s Copilot Pro and Meta's generative AI implications.

items.title: Apple’s plans for a smart display suffer a Siri-related setback
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Apple has delayed its Siri AI upgrade, impacting the launch of its rumored smart display.
- The smart display is expected to be a home hub with a display, similar to Amazon and Google offerings, supporting Apple Intelligence and running on tvOS.
- The release of the upgraded Siri is now delayed until the “coming year,” which may mean it won’t be included in iOS 18 as originally planned.

items.title: Some nice upgrades for Apple’s best gadgets
items.author: David Pierce
items.summary:
- The new MacBook Air features improved performance, a better webcam, and a lower price point.
- The new base model iPad is recommended as the best all-around option, priced at $349.
- Upcoming highlights include new releases such as "Daredevil: Born Again" and the game "Split Fiction." 
- Unique features of the Nothing Phone 3A include an Essential Space for organizing media.
- The article discusses various community recommendations and personal tech habits.

items.title: Retroid offered very limited returns for its unfixable handheld
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- The Retroid Pocket Mini has an unfixable screen issue affecting graphical effects for emulated games.
- Return window is limited to March 8th to March 14th and capped at 200 returns for customers outside China.
- Acknowledged problems include misplaced scanlines and distorted images, which cannot be fixed.
- Customers are required to pay for shipping returns, but Retroid promises reimbursement.
- Retroid is also offering a $10 coupon for future handheld purchases to all Pocket Mini owners.

items.title: The Last of Us season 2 gets an explosive new trailer
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Warner Bros. Discovery released a new trailer for *The Last of Us* season 2, highlighting the dangerous world protagonists Joel and Ellie face.
- The trailer features a snowy human settlement under attack by a zombie horde, showcasing numerous explosions and intense action scenes.
- Season two stars Jeffrey Wright as Isaac Dixon, Isabela Merced as Dina, and Kaitlyn Dever as Abby, and is set to premiere on April 13th on Max.

items.title: Trump’s DOJ still says Google should be broken up
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- The US DOJ is still advocating for the breakup of Google, insisting it must sell Google Chrome and potentially Android due to its monopolistic practices.
- The DOJ describes Google as an "economic goliath" that restricts consumer choice.
- The department has proposed that Google divest its Chrome browser and alter its Android operations to foster competition.
- The DOJ has relaxed some demands, now allowing Google to pay Apple for unrelated services and does not call for divestment of its AI investments, but requires notification for future AI investments.
- Google submitted its counterproposal, which does not involve selling Chrome but suggests restrictions on its business practices, such as licensing conditions.

items.title: Check your DVDs for disc rot — Warner Bros. says it’s replacing them
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Warner Bros. Home Entertainment acknowledged disc rot issues in DVDs produced from 2006 to 2008.
- Affected consumers can replace defective discs with the same title or a similar value title if the original is out of print.
- Disc rot can lead to unplayable DVDs, a problem that has been discussed extensively in forums like DVD Talk and Home Theater Forum.
- A YouTuber provided insights suggesting broader issues with discs from 2006 to 2009, and shared a list of known affected titles including popular series and films.
- Users can check for playback problems such as discs that won't load or freeze during playback.

items.title: The Apple Watch Series 10 just received its first $100 discount
items.author: Brandon Widder
items.summary:
• The Apple Watch Series 10 is currently discounted by $100, now available for $299 at retailers like Amazon, Walmart, and Best Buy.
• The watch features a larger OLED display, faster charging, and improved sleep apnea detection.
• The Series 10 can charge from 0 to 80% in just 30 minutes and offers fitness features integrated with watchOS 11.

items.title: It’s a great moment for classic RPGs
items.author: Andrew Webster
items.summary:
- The author reflects on playing classic RPGs, particularly focusing on the remastered collection of Suikoden, and its intricate storytelling.
- Notable recent releases include remastered versions of Dragon Quest 3 and Fantasian, both enhancing the RPG experience with updated visuals and gameplay improvements.
- Despite the presence of modern RPGs, the classic turn-based formula remains unique and continues to evolve, with more projects on the horizon from developers like Hironobu Sakaguchi.

items.title: The best entertainment of 2025
items.author: Andrew Webster
items.summary:
- A curated list of favorite games, TV shows, and movies from 2025.
- Recommendations include options for streaming, theaters, and various gaming devices.
- The list will be updated throughout the year with new favorites.

items.title: MainFrames is a charming platformer that takes place inside computers
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- MainFrames is an indie platformer where players control a floppy disk navigating computer desktops.
- Features charming characters, pixelated backgrounds, and a catchy chiptune soundtrack.
- Players can manipulate computer windows to solve puzzles and progress through levels.
- The game offers a variety of platforming challenges and accessibility features for easier play.
- Comparable to the game Celeste, it provides a quick respawn after failures, keeping gameplay engaging.
- MainFrames takes about four hours to complete and is available on Nintendo Switch and PC.

items.title: How Samsung's Galaxy Z Flip failed me without actually breaking
items.author: Sean Hollister
items.summary:
- The Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 7 is expected to be released this July and rumored to have a larger battery and outer screen.
- The author experienced significant battery issues with the Flip 5 after a year and a half, related to a software update.
- The battery life deteriorated to the point of needing to be charged frequently, significantly impacting usability.
- The author explores the trade-offs of owning a foldable phone, including compromises in battery life and functionality of the outer screen.
- After struggling with the Flip 5's battery, the author decided to trade it for a Galaxy S25, citing superior performance and battery life.

items.title: Jim Jordan subpoena pushes YouTube to restore ‘free speech’ like Meta
items.author: Tina Nguyen
items.summary:
- Rep. Jim Jordan subpoenaed Alphabet, demanding documents related to YouTube's content moderation at the request of the Biden administration.
- There is ongoing Republican concern that Big Tech is biased against conservative content, accelerated by the removal of Trump from Twitter.
- This follows a previous report stating that the Biden administration coerced Meta into removing content, leading to Meta's commitment to restore free speech on its platforms.

items.title: A Reddit moderation tool is flagging ‘Luigi’ as potentially violent content
items.author: Mia Sato
items.summary:
- Reddit's AutoModerator flagged the word "Luigi" as potentially violent content in unrelated posts.
- The issue arose in r/popculture, where a post about *Luigi's Mansion 3* was flagged.
- Reddit clarified there is no sitewide filter for "Luigi" but automation was triggered after the subreddit had only one remaining moderator.
- The r/popculture moderator announced closure due to unresolved issues with Reddit administration.
- The crackdown on potentially harmful content coincides with a new policy warning users about upvoting banned content.

items.title: US v. Google: all the news from the search antitrust showdown
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- The DOJ aims to break up Google’s search monopoly, proposing significant changes in Google’s operations.
- Judge Amit Mehta ruled that Google is a monopolist in the US search market.
- Google faces potential remedies including selling Chrome or altering default search arrangements. 
- Apple attempted to intervene in the trial but was denied by the court.
- DOJ's proposals include structural changes and adjustments in business practices to promote competition.

items.title: Inside the high-wire business of MrBeast
items.author: Alex Heath
items.summary:
- MrBeast, aka Jimmy Donaldson, is seeking to raise $200 million to value his company, Beast Industries, at over $5 billion.
- Investors anticipate that MrBeast will transition from video content to selling consumer products, such as his chocolate brand Feastables, which is projected to outpace video revenue.
- Beast Industries has lost approximately $200 million in recent years, with expectations for significant growth in CPG sales over the next few years, including beverages and snacks.
- The Content and Commerce divisions of Beast Industries both generated about $250 million in revenue for 2024, with a projected revenue of $900 million for 2025 and $1.6 billion for 2026.
- MrBeast has a high-risk approach to investment, reinvesting profits back into the business and maintaining a low personal bank balance, while reportedly excited about the potential rewards of risk-taking.

items.title: The hunt for the next Twitter: all the news about alternative social media platforms
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Elon Musk's takeover of Twitter (now X) started a race for alternative microblogging platforms.
- Viable alternatives like Threads, Mastodon, and Bluesky emerged, while Pebble and Post News shut down.
- Threads reported 275 million monthly users as of October 2024 and is integrating with the fediverse using ActivityPub.
- Bluesky, using its AT Protocol, is growing rapidly with over 14.5 million users post-2024 election.
- Mastodon struggles with user growth despite its established presence.
- No clear successor to Twitter; X remains a primary platform for many despite competition.
- New features in platforms include “followers only” replies and a new video tab on Bluesky profiles.

items.title: The best Nintendo Switch controllers to buy right now
items.author: Quentyn Kennemer
items.summary:
- The Joy-Cons included with the Switch may be convenient but lack comfort for long gaming sessions.
- The Nintendo Switch Pro Controller is recommended for TV mode, known for its build quality, long battery life, and additional features like HD rumble and NFC support.
- For handheld mode, the Hori Split Pad Pro offers improved ergonomics and rear buttons but lacks wireless functionality and some features.
- The GuliKit KingKong 3 Pro and Max provide Xbox-style designs with extensive customization options and compatibility with multiple devices.

items.title: Mickey 17 is a big middle finger to space-obsessed strongmen
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary: - Directed by Bong Joon Ho, known for Parasite, the film Mickey 17 is adapted from Edward Ashton’s novel Mickey 7. - The story follows Mickey Barnes, played by Robert Pattinson, in a near-apocalyptic Earth ravaged by climate issues as he takes a job as an expendable worker for space colonization. - Mickey, who is cloned each time he dies, faces dark comedic challenges amidst a chaotic political landscape, echoing themes relevant to current times. - The film features a blend of horror and humor as Mickey’s multiple deaths showcase the dangers of space exploration, with a comedic spin on his resurrected clones. - Mark Ruffalo plays the egotistical billionaire Kenneth Marshall, portraying the archetype of self-serving leaders, while the narrative unfolds into complex plotlines with Mickey's various clones.

items.title: Apple dodges a second Apple Watch ban
items.author: Victoria Song
items.summary:
- The US Court of Appeals for the Federal Circuit upheld a decision that AliveCor's EKG patents are not patentable, avoiding a second import ban on the Apple Watch.
- The case began in 2021 when AliveCor claimed Apple infringed upon its EKG patents, which led to an ITC import ban recommendation that was not enacted due to a conflicting ruling from the Patent Trial and Appeal Board.
- AliveCor expresses disappointment in the ruling and plans to explore legal options, while Apple asserts its commitment to developing health and safety features for users.

items.title: Volkswagen is bringing back physical buttons
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- Volkswagen plans to reintroduce physical buttons in vehicles for vital functions like climate and volume controls.
- The decision is based on customer feedback, emphasizing the need for traditional controls in cars.
- New controls will begin with the upcoming ID 2all model, set for release next year.
- This shift follows similar realizations from other manufacturers like Hyundai, responding to user frustrations with touchscreen controls.
- EU's NCAP will require certain physical controls for a full five-star safety rating starting next year, impacting design choices.

items.title: Uranium is in the crosshairs of the US-Canada tariff battle
items.author: Justine Calma
items.summary:
- President Trump’s tariff threats could raise uranium prices, affecting US nuclear reactors and the nuclear energy sector.
- The US sources over a quarter of its uranium from Canada; recent tariffs were implemented but subsequently paused due to market reactions.
- A proposed 10% tariff on Canadian energy products could lead to a similar rise in uranium prices, impacting suppliers like Cameco.
- The Nuclear Energy Institute expressed concerns that tariffs may hinder growth and innovation in the energy sector.
- Growing interest in nuclear energy from major tech companies is driving up uranium prices, which has led to a resurgence in domestic uranium mining.
- The US holds about 1% of the world’s uranium reserves, compared to Canada’s much larger share, raising concerns about reliance on foreign supply amid tariff discussions.

items.title: Go Read This: The Verge’s favorite reads from all over the web
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- The Verge provides a continuously updated list of recommended articles from across the internet, including journalism, analyses, studies, and fiction.
- The list aims to help users discover high-quality content amidst the overwhelming amount of information available online.
- Featured articles cover diverse topics, including workplace experiences, game development, the history of fonts, and current events in politics and technology.

items.title: US tariffs: how Trump’s tax is hitting Big Tech and beyond
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- President Trump’s tariffs impact goods from Mexico, Canada, and China.
- Automakers fear significant effects due to tariffs on imported parts and materials.
- Big Tech companies largely remain silent on tariffs despite potential business impacts.
- CEOs from Best Buy and Target warn of imminent price increases due to tariffs, especially on food items from Mexico.
- Trump confirms tariffs will take effect as scheduled, increasing costs on various imports including electronics and auto parts.

items.title: The best wireless earbuds to buy right now
items.author: Chris Welch
items.summary:
- The wireless earbuds market has improved significantly, with brands like Sony, Apple, and Samsung offering high-quality options.
- Key factors in choosing earbuds include comfort, sound quality preference, noise cancellation, battery life, and water resistance (minimum IPX4).
- Different earbuds are recommended for specific needs such as fitness, calls, and sound quality; links to the best options are provided in the article.
- The Sony WF-1000XM5 earbuds are highlighted as the best overall with superior ANC and sound quality, priced at $298.
- Budget option: Nothing's Ear (a) earbuds for $95, featuring ANC and good sound quality.
- Bose QuietComfort Ultra Earbuds are noted for their powerful noise cancellation, priced at $219.
- The article provides options for various preferences, including best earbuds for sports, budget, and overall performance.

items.title: Netflix’s plan to spend $18 billion on content is ‘not anywhere near the ceiling’
JD Vance is posting through it
DeepSeek: all the news about the startup that’s shaking up AI stocks
LG’s new air conditioner directs cool air towards people it detects
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- The LG Artcool AI Air uses occupant sensing to improve energy efficiency by directing airflow to detected individuals.
- It does not include design elements of previous models but focuses on comfort and efficiency.
- Pricing and availability have yet to be announced, and the technology behind its sensing capabilities remains unspecified, though mmWave radar sensing is suggested.

items.title: Trump’s First 100 Days: Impacts on the Tech Industry
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- President Trump signed an executive order to create a Strategic Bitcoin Reserve for digital assets seized by the government.
- The reserve is likened to a ‘digital Fort Knox’ and is expected to hold around 200,000 Bitcoin.
- The executive order mandates exploration of additional Bitcoin acquisitions without using taxpayer funds.
- Trump’s tariffs on Mexico and Canada are mostly suspended, repealing previous protections claimed as necessary against drug and migrant flows.
- AI technology will be used by the State Department to revoke student visas of students involved in pro-Palestine protests.
- Social Security Administration staff are barred from accessing general news sites on government devices.
- Criticism arises over the government's move to regulate crypto assets and the perceived connections between crypto donations and political power.

items.title: The M4-powered Mac Mini has returned to its Black Friday sale price
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- The M4-powered Mac Mini is on sale for $529, matching its all-time low price.
- The desktop offers a 10-core CPU and GPU, with 256GB storage at this price.
- It features five Thunderbolt ports, gigabit ethernet, HDMI, a 3.5mm jack, and can support up to three displays.
- The base model includes 16GB of RAM and has been praised for its compact size and performance.

items.title: Apple delays upgraded Siri: it’s taking ‘longer than we thought’
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Apple spokesperson Jacqueline Roy announced that the rollout of more personalized Siri features will take longer than expected.
- The initial expectation was for the new features to arrive this spring.
- Apple aims to enhance Siri's capabilities, including a better understanding of personal context and integration with apps, but has not specified a timeline beyond 'the coming year'.
- Previous announcements at WWDC introduced advanced features for Siri, but reports suggest that a complete overhaul may not happen until iOS 20 at the earliest.

items.title: Crypto funds seized by the government may go into a ‘digital Fort Knox’
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- President Trump signed an executive order to establish a Bitcoin reserve for the US government, including around 200,000 Bitcoin from forfeitures.
- The reserve will function like a 'digital Fort Knox' and will also include other digital assets.
- The US government will explore ways to acquire more Bitcoin without using taxpayer dollars.
- David Sacks stated that the bitcoin will be kept as a store of value, aiming to avoid past losses incurred from premature sales.
- Bitcoin price is currently at $86,000, having faced significant volatility in the past.

items.title: AMD is launching its latest Ryzen 9 X3D gaming processors on March 12th
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- AMD announces launch of Ryzen 9 9950X3D and 9900X3D processors on March 12th.
- New processors feature 16 Zen 5 cores and second-generation 3D V-Cache technology, enhancing both gaming and content creation.
- The Ryzen 9 9950X3D is priced at $699, with 4.3 GHz base clock speed and 5.7 GHz boost, offering 144MB cache and a TDP of 170W.
- The entry-level 9900X3D will cost $599, slightly above Intel’s comparable offering.
- The announcement follows AMD’s recent launch of competitive GPUs, Radeon RX 9070 and 9070 XT.

items.title: The Nintendo Switch 2 will have NFC and Wi-Fi 6, FCC filings show
items.author: Sean Hollister
items.summary:
- The Nintendo Switch 2 will support NFC for Amiibo figurines, confirmed by FCC filings.
- It is designated BEE-001 and will have a right Joy-Con for NFC like the original Switch.
- The console will support Wi-Fi 6 (802.11ax) with up to 80MHz bandwidth, but not Wi-Fi 7 or 6E.
- Charging will be possible via a top USB-C port in addition to the bottom one.
- The original Switch's charging specs will still apply, with a possibility of faster or more powerful charging.
- The exact release date for the Nintendo Switch 2 is still to be announced by Nintendo later this year.

items.title: Nintendo Switch 2 Announcement: Key Details and Features
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Nintendo announced the Switch 2 with no specific release date beyond 2025.
- The Switch 2 features a larger size than the original Switch, with Joy-Con controllers designed to attach magnetically.
- Upcoming Nintendo Direct scheduled for April 2 to reveal more details about the console.
- FCC filings indicate support for NFC and Wi-Fi 6, enhancing connectivity options.
- Nintendo is discontinuing the My Nintendo Gold Points system ahead of the Switch 2 launch.
- Rumors suggest Joy-Con controllers may function similarly to a mouse, expanding gameplay possibilities.
- The company is actively adjusting production strategies to meet anticipated demand for the new console.

items.title: Switch 2: all the news and rumors on Nintendo’s next console
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Nintendo revealed initial details about the Switch 2, stating a release year of 2025.
- The new console is larger than the original Switch and features new Joy-Con controllers with colored accents.
- Joy-Con controllers attach magnetically to the console.
- Players can try out the Switch 2 at public events starting in April.
- The Switch 2 will support original Nintendo Switch cartridges.
- A new Mario Kart game is teased for the Switch 2.
- The console will include NFC support and Wi-Fi 6 according to FCC filings.
- Nintendo plans to discontinue the My Nintendo Gold Points program on March 25, 2025, possibly to introduce a new rewards scheme.

items.title: SpaceX’s latest Starship explosion lights up the sky over the Caribbean again
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- SpaceX's eighth test flight ended with an explosion, similar to the previous test flight in January.
- Following a successful launch and separation from the Super Heavy booster, Starship lost several Raptor engines due to an explosion, leading to a loss of attitude control.
- The FAA issued ground stops for several Florida airports due to falling debris, with operations resuming after about an hour.

items.title: Netflix brought back A Different World of AI-upscaled nightmare fuel
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Netflix's remaster of *A Different World* is criticized for poor AI upscaling, resulting in distorted visuals.
- Issues with the remaster became apparent after the show was added to Netflix in February, including illegible text and deformed graphics.
- Developer Scott Hanselman commented on the limitations of current AI upscaling technology.
- The show was previously available on other platforms without these upscaling problems, raising questions about Netflix's quality control.
- The rights to *A Different World* are held by Carsey-Werner, which also affects other shows with similar issues.

items.title: Apple’s The Studio makes moviemaking look like a crucible in latest trailer
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- Apple TV Plus launches a new comedy series titled *The Studio*, co-created by Seth Rogen and others.
- The show centers around Matt Remick, played by Rogen, who is the new head of Continental Studios.
- The series features a cast of celebrity guest stars like Martin Scorsese and Ice Cube, appearing as themselves.
- *The Studio* is set to premiere on March 26th, aiming for a strong comedic impact similar to HBO’s *The Franchise*.

items.title: Google screwed up Pixel vibrations again
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- Following the March 2025 update, Pixel devices are experiencing unusual changes in notification and call vibrations.
- Users report a 'hollow feeling' vibration with reduced intensity, as discussed on the Google Pixel subreddit.
- This issue recalls a previous incident in 2022 when an update weakened notification vibrations in Pixel 6 phones, which was later fixed.
- Staffers at Verge notice similar changes on Pixel 8 Pro devices, while discrepancies appear across different models, with the Pixel 9 series reportedly unaffected.
- It's currently unclear if this alteration is a bug or an intentional change; Google has been contacted for clarification.

items.title: Four book logging apps to keep you reading
items.author: Barbara Krasnoff
items.summary:
- The article discusses four book logging apps as alternatives to Goodreads.
- Goodreads has been a popular platform for tracking reading habits but has received criticism for issues like review bombing.
- Alternatives include The StoryGraph, Bookly, and Bookmory, each with unique features aimed at reading goals and community engagement.
- The StoryGraph allows users to easily transfer data from Goodreads and offers a cleaner interface with detailed stats.
- Bookly focuses on tracking reading sessions, encouraging habits through notifications, and includes features for timed sessions and reflections.
- Bookmory emphasizes progress tracking and offers both free and premium versions with various functionalities for readers.

items.title: Apple’s chip bumps, big and small
items.author: David Pierce
items.summary:
- Apple updated the iPad, iPad Air, MacBook Air, and Mac Studio with new processors, but the updates are considered minor.
- Discussion on the lack of compelling reasons to upgrade Apple products.
- Covers tech news including the Digg relaunch, Nothing Phone 3A, Volkswagen ID. EVERY1, and the end of Skype.
- Brief discussion on tariffs, government actions, and a unique smartphone prototype.

items.title: MWC 2025 Showcases Wacky and Innovative Mobile Tech
items.author: Allison Johnson
items.summary:
- Mobile World Congress showcased a mix of expected and unusual mobile tech innovations this year.
- Notable highlights include the Xiaomi 15 Ultra, which features a new 200-megapixel periscope camera addressing previous telephoto camera issues.
- The Nothing Phone 3A series introduced an AI-powered feature for organizing digital content, enhancing their brand's appeal.
- Other innovations featured in the conference include phones with color-changing backs, solar-powered phone cases, and several unique accessories.
- Samsung Display and Lenovo presented creative concepts, including foldable gaming devices and laptops that fold multiple times.

items.title: Intuitive Machine’s lunar landing goes sideways again
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Intuitive Machines' second lunar lander, Athena, landed on the Moon but not in an upright position.
- Landed 100 miles from the lunar south pole on February 26, 2024; orientation could affect mission duration.
- Previous lander, Odysseus, also had an unstable landing.
- Mission is part of NASA's efforts to return crewed missions to the Moon.
- Lander carries 11 payloads aimed at finding water on the lunar surface.
- Communication is ongoing, but power generation and performance are sub-optimal, reducing mission lifespan.

items.title: Android phones are getting lock screen widgets this year
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary:
- Google announced that lock screen widgets will be introduced in Android 16 later this year.
- The feature has been available on the Pixel Tablet since last year and will now extend to phones and more tablets.
- All widgets will support lock screen functions by default, with app developers having the option to disable it.
- Certain actions for widgets will still require user authentication via fingerprint, PIN, or face unlock.
- Lock screen widgets will be added to the Android Open Source Project in the first quarterly update after Android 16's release, scheduled for late summer.
- Android 16 is currently in beta and set to release in June.
- Currently, lock screen widgets for phones are only accessible through the screensaver mode and not yet enabled in the latest beta.

items.title: Apple has 90 days to allow app sideloading in Brazil
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Apple must allow alternative app stores on iOS in Brazil within 90 days as per the antitrust ruling.
- The ruling follows a complaint filed by Mercado Livre in 2022 and references similar obligations Apple meets in other countries.
- Apple plans to appeal the ruling, arguing it can maintain competitive markets without significant harm.

items.title: Gundam GQuuuuuuX will stream on Amazon next month
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- English-speaking Gundam fans will be able to stream dubbed versions of Gundam GQuuuuuuX starting April 8th.
- Amazon Prime has secured rights to stream both dubbed and subbed versions in over 240 countries as episodes debut on Japanese television.
- The show is produced by studio Khara, directed by Kazyua Tsurumaki, with writing contributions from Hideaki Anno and Yōji Enokido.

items.title: The best Xbox controller to buy right now
items.author: Quentyn Kennemer
items.summary:
- The Xbox Wireless Controller offers great ergonomic design and comfort, making it a top choice for most users.
- Alternatives include the 8BitDo Ultimate Wired Controller, which features Hall effect sticks and programmable buttons at a lower price.
- The Xbox Elite Wireless Controller Series 2 is highlighted for its modular customization and premium feel but comes at a higher price point.
